simple.What is the main function of a resistor: A resistor limits or controls the flow of electrical current in a circuit. It reduces voltage and current according to Ohm's Law.
simple.Name three examples of sensors commonly: Common Arduino sensors include DHT11 temperature sensor, HC-SR04 ultrasonic distance sensor, and PIR motion sensor.
simple.What does LED stand for, and how do you: LED stands for Light Emitting Diode. Always use a current-limiting resistor in series to prevent excessive current damage.
simple.What is the basic difference between Vol: Voltage is electrical pressure (measured in Volts) that pushes electrons. Current is the actual flow of electrons (measured in Amperes).
simple.Which microcontroller is more commonly u: Arduino Uno is more common for beginners because it has simpler programming and extensive community support.

complex.Conceptually explain how Pulse Width Mod: PWM rapidly switches output ON and OFF. The duty cycle (percentage of ON time) controls average power delivered. Higher duty cycle means brighter LED or faster motor.
complex.In the context of serial communication b: UART uses point-to-point connection with 2 wires (TX, RX) at speeds up to 115200 baud. I2C uses bus topology with 2 wires (SDA, SCL) supporting multiple devices at 100-400 kHz.
complex.A circuit uses a linear regulator LM7805: Power dissipated = (12V - 5V) Ã— 0.5A = 3.5W as heat. Switching regulators are more efficient (80-95%) because they use switching instead of linear voltage drop.
complex.You want to read an analog voltage from: The ADC samples the analog voltage and converts it to a digital value. With 10-bit resolution, it divides 0-5V into 1024 levels, giving values from 0-1023.
complex.What is meant by Interrupt in microcontr: An interrupt temporarily halts program execution to handle urgent tasks. For buttons, interrupts respond immediately to presses without constantly checking, saving CPU cycles.

true_false_basic.Capacitors can store electric charge and: True. Capacitors store charge and filter voltage ripples in power supplies.
true_false_basic.An NPN transistor turns ON when the base: False. NPN transistors turn ON when base voltage is higher than emitter by approximately 0.7V.
true_false_basic.Digital pins on a microcontroller can on: True. Digital pins operate in binary states, either HIGH or LOW voltage.
true_false_basic.Ohm's Law states that Current (I) is dir: False. The correct formula is I = V / R (current equals voltage divided by resistance).
true_false_basic.The higher the resistor value connected: True. Higher resistance reduces current flow, resulting in dimmer LED brightness.

true_false_advanced.The ESP32 platform from Espressif not on: True. ESP32 supports Arduino IDE, MicroPython, and Rust programming frameworks.
true_false_advanced.In modern IoT development, the MQTT prot: False. Both MQTT and HTTP are used in IoT. MQTT's advantage is lower overhead and efficiency, not necessarily higher speed.
true_false_advanced.To connect external sensors or modules t: True. Breakout boards include pull-up resistors and voltage regulators, simplifying connections.
true_false_advanced.Single Board Computers like the Raspberr: True. Raspberry Pi runs complete operating systems while Arduino executes a single program from flash memory.
true_false_advanced.In the microcontroller world, LoRa wirel: True. LoRa achieves ranges of 2-15 kilometers with low power consumption, ideal for long-range IoT.
